title: Deploying RRASSLER
text: first set sample data comes us FEMA region 6 Base Level Engineering data https://ebfedata.s3.amazonaws.com/ based pointers https://webapps.usgs.gov/infrm/estBFE/. See also Texas specific dashboard https://www.arcgis.com/apps/dashboards/1e98f1e511fc40d3b08790a4251a64ee BLE models. testing purposes, ’ve selected 3 models HUC 12090301 left original folder structure (“\12090301\12090301_modelsCreek-Colorado River”). models use English units assumed “EPSG:2277” projection.

title: RRASSLER Ingest Steps
text: order wrassle friction, RRASSLER theoretical value judgments need described order help understand use properly. RRASSLER focused making critical data objects needed run HEC-RAS model readily available accountable model (opposed individual data points large clusters otherwise “vistigal” data; emphasis particular geometric realization model). also designed standardized centralized source models, regardless origin. reason, RRASSLER expects operate within ’s controlled directory, “HECRAS_model_catalog”. Users first download unpack desired models temporary location, point RRASSLER directory place want store catalog. : Greedly scrape entire directory structure HEC-RAS model projects (defined *.prj) geometric realization model (variation *.g##), grab files : Attempt place model space. done attempting parse g** g**.hdf files, guess projections, pulling collating data xid-xyz table. process errors , model appended 3_, placed catalog hull created, attempt joint model reference hydrofabric locate “Primary downstream divergence” (first COMID maximum levelpath underneath footprint). process errors reason, model appended 1_ feature join, model model joined, ID primary downstream divergence appended model key. can constructed, model assumed correctly placed space. relevant model files copied uniquely parsed “final_model_name_key” folder /models/ folder. creation model hull errors , model placed _/models/unprocessed folder investigation, correction, rewrassling. iterations files done, RRASSLER (re)generate unified source model footprints, cross sections, points (now spatial form) HEC-RAS model, pointers back copied source data remains unaltered. workflow loosely diagrammed follows:  Let’s take look “real life” examples outputs interpret .  Note process “HECRAS_model_catalog” location agnostic. Therefore, although operating local files may RRASSLE ether local directory s3 bucket using commands. RRASSLER also handles “folder structure” differences S3 protocols disk representations, “bucket” argument can look just like folder path can “root” folder S3 URL intelligently parsed .

title: Mapping RRASSLER
text: Remerge generated catalog index create recreate index files top catalog, including: * Model footprints: model_footprints.fgb * Cross sections: XS.fgb * Points: point_database.parquet  Create handy map view function create stand alone leaflet map useful “interactively” exploring data, facilitating simple queries, inspirational presentations.
code: RRASSLER::refresh_master_files(path_to_ras_dbase = cat_path,verbose = TRUE) RRASSLER::map_library(path_to_ras_dbase = cat_path,NULL,name = "model_map",plot_lines = TRUE,chart_lines = FALSE,refresh = FALSE,quiet = FALSE)

title: Mapping RRASSLER
code: RRASSLER::append_catalog_fields(path_to_ras_dbase = cat_path,out_name = "OWP_ras_model_catalog.csv",overwrite = FALSE,is_quiet = TRUE)

title: Model-debug
code: xyz = arrow::read_parquet("~/temp/ras_xyz.parquet") utils::head(xyz,5) ls = sfheaders::sf_linestring(   obj = xyz   , x = "x"   , y = "y"   # , z = "z"   , linestring_id = "xid"   , keep = FALSE ) |> sf::st_set_crs(sf::st_crs("EPSG:6349")) sf::st_write(ls,"~/temp/ras_xyz_lines.fgb")

title: Model-debug
code: xs_t <- data.table::as.data.table(sf::st_drop_geometry(xs)) feet_t <- data.table::as.data.table(sf::st_drop_geometry(feet)) xs_t <- xs_t[, dummy := master_id]  data.table::setkey(xs_t, master_id, dummy) data.table::setkey(feet_t, start_master_id, end_master_id) temp_table <- data.table::foverlaps(xs_t, feet_t, nomatch=0L, mult="first")[, dummy := NULL] xs_j <- xs %>% dplyr::left_join(temp_table) mapview::mapview(xs_j)

title: Model-debug
code: extrated_pts <- try({       parse_model_to_xyz(         geom_path = g_file,         units = current_model_units,         proj_string = current_model_projection,         in_epoch_override = as.integer(as.POSIXct(Sys.time())),         out_epoch_override = as.integer(as.POSIXct(Sys.time())),         vdat_trans = FALSE,         quiet = is_verbose       )     })  ls = sfheaders::sf_linestring(       obj = extrated_pts[[1]],       x = "x",       y = "y",       linestring_id = "xid",       keep = FALSE) |> sf::st_set_crs(sf::st_crs("EPSG:6349"))     ls_final_line_index <- nrow(ls)     ls_end_index <- nrow(ls)-1     ls_middlel_lines_end <- ls[2:ls_end_index,] |> lwgeom::st_endpoint()     ls_middlel_lines_start <- ls[2:ls_end_index,] %>% lwgeom::st_startpoint()      df_hull_pts <- rbind(       sf::st_coordinates(ls[1,]$geometry)[, -c(3)],       sf::st_coordinates(ls_middlel_lines_end),       apply(sf::st_coordinates(ls[ls_final_line_index,]$geometry)[, -c(3)], 2, rev),       apply(sf::st_coordinates(ls_middlel_lines_start), 2, rev))     hull = sfheaders::sf_polygon(       obj = df_hull_pts,       x = "X",       y = "Y",       keep = FALSE) |> sf::st_set_crs(sf::st_crs("EPSG:6349"))  flow_catch_list <- try({   nhdplusTools::get_nhdplus(AOI::aoi_get(hull), realization = "catchment") }) |> suppressMessages() flow_line_list <- try({   nhdplusTools::get_nhdplus(AOI::aoi_get(hull), realization = "flowline") }) |> suppressMessages()  flow_catch_intersect <- flow_catch_list[sf::st_transform(hull,crs = sf::st_crs(flow_catch_list)),] flow_line_intersect <- flow_line_list[sf::st_transform(hull,crs = sf::st_crs(flow_line_list)),]  mapview::mapview(extrated_pts[[3]]) + mapview::mapview(hull) + mapview::mapview(ls) + mapview::mapview(flow_line_intersect)

title: Model-debug
code: path_to_gdb <- file.path("~/data/ras_catalog/_temp/BLE/12090301/12090301_SpatialData/Spatial/BLE_LowColoradoCummins.gdb") fc <- sf::st_read(path_to_gdb,layer="BLE_DEP01PCT") print(sf::st_crs(fc))

title: Model-debug
code: import argparse import tarfile import os from pathlib import Path # file="C:\Users\rdp-user\Projects\data\ras_models\_temp\IFC\07020009.tar.gz" # ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ def unpacker(str_huc8_arg,str_tar_file):     str_out_dir = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(str_tar_file),str_huc8_arg)       if not os.path.exists(str_tar_file):         print('File does not exist?')         print(str_tar_file)         return              if os.path.exists(str_out_dir):         print('File already unpacked')         return          os.mkdir(str_out_dir)      # read the tar.gz file... this takes some time     t = tarfile.open(str_tar_file, "r:gz")      for member in t.getmembers():         if member.name[-3:-2] == 'g' or member.name[-3:-2] == 'p' or member.name[-3:-2] == 'f' or member.name[-3:-2] == 'h' or member.name[-3:-2] == 'v':             #print(member.name)             t.extract(member, str_out_dir)      print(" Done ")     return  if __name__ == '__main__':     parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='========== IFC by (HUC8) ==========')      parser.add_argument('-w',                         dest = "str_huc8_arg",                         help = 'REQUIRED: HUC-8 watershed that is being evaluated: Example: 10170204',                         required = True,                         type = str)  # has to be string so it doesn't strip the leading zero      parser.add_argument('-i',                         dest = "str_tar_file",                         help = r'OPTIONAL: path containing the HEC_RAS files: Example -i C:\HEC\input_folder\my_models.' \                                r' Defaults to c:\ras2fim_datas\OWP_ras_models\models.',                         required = False,                         type = str)          args = vars(parser.parse_args())          unpacker(**args)

what: Grab spatial key file (huc8 bounds & names) from s3
title: Model-debug
code: Sys.setenv("AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID" = "mykey",            "AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY" = "mysecretkey",            "AWS_DEFAULT_REGION" = "us-east-1") aws.s3::save_object(   object = ".../HUC8.fgb",   bucket = "s3://.../.../HUC8.fgb",   file = "<path to your catalog>/HUC8.fgb" )

title: Model-debug
code: root_path <- "../inst/extdata/sample_ras/FEMA-R6-BLE-sample-dataset/12090301/12090301_models/Model/Alum Creek-Colorado River/ALUM 006/ALUM 006.g01" units = "English Units" proj_string = "EPSG:2277" # root_path <- "../inst/extdata/sample_ras/ras2fim-sample-dataset/input_iowa/10170204000897/Hydraulic_Models/Simulations/10170204000897.g01" # units = "SI Units" # proj_string = "EPSG:26915"  pts_g <- process_ras_g_to_xyz(geom_path = root_path,units = units,proj_string = proj_string,vdat = FALSE,quiet = FALSE) pts_ghdf <- process_ras_hdf_to_xyz(geom_path = paste0(root_path,".hdf"),units = units,proj_string = proj_string,vdat = FALSE,quiet = FALSE)  sf::st_write(pts_g[[3]],"../inst/extdata/sample_output/riv_g.fgb") sf::st_write(pts_ghdf[[3]],"../inst/extdata/sample_output/riv_ghdf.fgb")  sf::st_write(xyz_to_ls(dat = pts_g[[1]],is_quiet = FALSE),"../inst/extdata/sample_output/xs_g.fgb") sf::st_write(xyz_to_ls(dat = pts_ghdf[[1]],is_quiet = FALSE),"../inst/extdata/sample_output/xs_ghdf.fgb")  data.table::fwrite(pts_g[[1]],"../inst/extdata/sample_output/xs.csv") data.table::fwrite(pts_ghdf[[1]],"../inst/extdata/sample_output/xsghdf.csv")

what: FEMA region 6 BLE data scraper — scrape_ble_lib
title: FEMA region 6 BLE data scraper — scrape_ble_lib
text: Helper download relevant BLE data

title: FEMA region 6 BLE data scraper — scrape_ble_lib
code: scrape_ble_lib(   database_path,   HUCID,   is_quiet = FALSE,   overwrite = overwrite,   files = "m" )

title: FEMA region 6 BLE data scraper — scrape_ble_lib
text: database_path Path load data .  NOTE: Must LOCAL path HUCID huc8 ID string try scrape is_quiet flag determine whether print statements suppressed, TRUE suppress messages FALSE show , Default: FALSE overwrite overwrite flag data already loaded path. TRUE remove re-download., Default: overwrite files string encoding determine files attempt download, can contain 'm' models, 's' spatial data, 'd' documentation, Default: 'm'

title: FEMA region 6 BLE data scraper — scrape_ble_lib
text: requested BLE data scraped zip file

title: FEMA region 6 BLE data scraper — scrape_ble_lib
text: Scraping data https://ebfedata.s3.amazonaws.com/ based pointers https://webapps.usgs.gov/infrm/estBFE/.  See also Texas specific dashboard https://www.arcgis.com/apps/dashboards/1e98f1e511fc40d3b08790a4251a64ee BLE base models.

title: FEMA region 6 BLE data scraper — scrape_ble_lib
code: if (FALSE) { if(interactive()){  #EXAMPLE1  database_path <- file.path("~/data/ras_catalog/")  RRASSLER::scrape_ble_lib(database_path,'12090301',is_quiet = FALSE,overwrite = FALSE,files = "ms")  } }

title: URL tester — url_exists
text: gratefully pilfered https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52911812/check--url-exists--r

title: URL tester — url_exists
code: #EXAMPLE1 some_urls <- c(   "https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52911812/check-if-url-exists-in-r",   "http://jim.is/a/bad/programmer/",   "https://github.com/NOAA-OWP/inundation-mapping" ) data.frame(   exists = sapply(some_urls, url_exists, USE.NAMES = FALSE),   some_urls,   stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) %>% tibble::as_tibble() %>% print() #> Warning: Requests for [http://jim.is/a/bad/programmer/] responded but without an HTTP status code in the 200-299 range #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   exists some_urls                                                             #>   <lgl>  <chr>                                                                 #> 1 TRUE   https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52911812/check-if-url-exists-in-r #> 2 FALSE  http://jim.is/a/bad/programmer/                                       #> 3 TRUE   https://github.com/NOAA-OWP/inundation-mapping
